revised_title: Electrons in Liquid Metals and Disordered Systems: A Pseudopotential Approach
tldr: The author presents a review of the electrical properties of liquid metals and disordered systems, focusing on the pseudopotential theory. The theory is based on the concept of nearly free electrons scattered by the screened pseudopotentials of the assembly of ions. The author discusses the limitations and extensions of the pseudopotential approach and its applications to various disordered systems, such as liquid semiconductors, metallic vapors, and semiconductivity glasses.
